entry.title: gl: make gl::GLContext store offscreen surface
entry.content:
OzoneImageBacking will start to cache glTextures soon to

avoid additional overhead of construction/destruction. However,

it needs to do that on correct contexts. Thus, the caching

mechanism has to store a correct surface that was used to initialize

the context. (https://crrev.com/c/4876722)



The easiest way to do that is to make the gl::GLContext store

the surface if it was an offscreen one when the context was

initialized. Moreover, there is a number of places that keep

the offscreen surface for the sake of initializing of a context

and making it current. Thus, this change also helps to clean

up such places and make the code look cleaner.



The following changes have been done to this CL.

1) gl::GLContext stores the gl::GLSurface iff it's the offscreen

one.

2) InitializeImpl() was added that each subclass must implement.

2) MakeCurrentDefault() was added so that the call sites can use that directly without accessing the surface if they don't care about the

surface when make current.



In the next CL, the call sites will be updated.



Bug: 1479884

entry.title: Defer creating publishers after reading AppStorage.
entry.content:
This CL is the follow up for CL:4864361. Defer creating PublisherHost

to wait for reading from the AppStorage file to prevent overwriting the

`fresh` apps from publishers during the system init phase.



For OnApps requests before reading the AppStorage file, add them to

`pending_on_apps_requests_`. After reading the AppStorage file, execute

OnApps requests saved in `pending_on_apps_requests_`.



Add OneShotEvent, `on_ready_`, to cache tasks before reading the AppStorage file. After reading the AppStorage file, execute tasks saved

in `on_ready_`.



BUG=1385932

entry.title: graphite: Allow fallback to R16 in VideoResourceUpdater
entry.content:
1) Allow using R16 textures for uploading 10-bit video instead of half

float luminance by introducing a new supports_r16_shared_images flag

which is enabled only for ANGLE Metal and Skia Graphite.



2) Disallow luminance shared images when Skia Graphite is used. Similar

to what we already do for ANGLE Metal.



3) Add RG_88 to the list of supported GMB formats on all non-Lacros

platforms, and R_16 and RG_1616 for mac/iOS. R_8 without RG_88 means

that the primary plane could be allocated as a R_8 scanout GMB image,

while the secondary plane could be a RG_88 non-scanout image which

clearly isn't the intended behavior - this shouldn't matter except in

the VideoResourceUpdater path only when half float luminance is not

supported - the other place which calls this function is UIResource

which should never use RG_88.



Bug: 1487765

Change-Id: I00705af7e011d642c59a95e8027eb5c2f40e4d7a

entry.title: Move AppRegistryCache::OnApps to the private method.
entry.content:
This CL is used to prepare for CL:4930449. We suggest using

AppServiceProxy::OnApps if possible, because there are some specific

handing for preference, app storage, etc in AppServiceProxy::OnApps.

So we move AppRegistryCache::OnApps to the private method to prevent

calling it from the production code.



For some tests without Profile, we provide OnAppsForTesting for

testing only, e.g. for unit tests.



Modify the test code to use AppServiceProxy::OnApps.



Modify app_registry_cache.cc to keep the consistent sequence as the

definition in app_registry_cache.h.



This CL is pure refactor, and no change on the production code.

entry.title: [CloudOpenMetrics] Handle every inconsistency the same way
entry.content:
Previously upon an inconsistency:

- If a metric was inconsistent with another metric, log information

about both of them.

- Otherwise, log information about the single metric.



Why change?:

- Debug information was printed through different methods leading to

confusing code.

- In the former case, this information can be derived through the

PrintMetrics() call anyway.



Simplify the code by only printing information out about the single

inconsistent metric. Introduce PrintDebugInformationIfInconsistent()

as the entry point for all possible inconsistent metrics.



Update CloudOpenMetrics methods ExpectNotLogged(), ExpectLogged() and

ExpectLoggedWith() to have a single metric parameter. Also, flip

the parameters of ExpectLoggedWith() for better readability.



Rename Metric methods ExpectNotLogged(), ExpectLogged() and

ExpectLoggedWith() to MakeInconsistentIfLogged(),

MakeInconsistentIfNotLogged() and MakeInconsistentIfNotLoggedWith().



Update Metric::Log() to not return anything and not print anything

as PrintDebugInformationIfInconsistent() will handle this.



Also, update PrintMetrics() to print all the metrics.



Bug: b/300861997

Change-Id: I0052aed7e6ef27173774a110abaea49f468ce05e

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4938323

entry.title: Audio: Set default of isAllowAGCEnabled as True
entry.content:
To avoid recording spawned UMA record of `Cras.ForceRespectUiGains`.



Because `isAllowAGCEnabled` and `ForceRespectUiGains` are inversed state,

by default, `ForceRespectUiGains` is false and `isAllowAGCEnabled` should

be true. Without specifying the default state of `isAllowAGCEnabled`, it

will be default false on the UI. When users open the settings page, the

toggle will be created with default off and sync with the

`ForceRespectUiGains` to be switched on. This will trigger an event of

UMA record which is not distinguishable with actual users toggling the

button.



BUG=b:304787325

Test=built, deployed to dut and verified.

entry.title: input_method_private: Refactor out shared language packs code
entry.content:
A future CL uses `ResultToStatus` in another .cc file. This CL refactors

out the aforementioned function into a separate header/implementation so

it can be shared between the two files.



`language_packs_extensions_util.{h,cc}` is intentionally verbosely named

entry.title: Close extension message channel if the frame with ports enters BFCache
entry.content:
When a page enters BFCache, the extension message channel with ports

registered on the cached frames should be closed. No message will be

delivered to the frame in BFCache. It will fire a `onDisconnect`

event on the other end (extension background). Because of this, we won't

evict BFCache entry if a message is unexpectedly delivered to the

BFCached frame.



The logic is behind a feature flag

`kDisconnectExtensionMessagePortWhenPageEntersBFCache`. The browser

test is updated accordingly.



Please refer to this doc for more information: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1aWokmpgY6HVNhKdh4Q3DOn4c5dUdi5gBXBUpcpZEHNw/edit?usp=sharing



Bug: 1488379

entry.title: [text-autospace] sort bounds by physical order before calculating
entry.content:
advance



If the text contains RTL text, iterating over characters in strings

would be in a different order from the physical order. So then, some

advances might be negative.

So this CL sorts the bounds by physical orders first, then calculate

the advance.

It also makes a minor change to transpose part, to ensure that

- bounds.bottom is always greater than bounds.top

- bounds.right is always greater than bounds.left,

so then the array of bounds gets sortable.

entry.title: [omnibox][ml][chrome://omnibox] Add chrome://omnibox/ml (6/6)
entry.content:
https://screenshot.googleplex.com/B36db39XGhcdxVz

https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3YZYX5mNgwM2Q76



This CL allows:

1. Comparing ML and traditional ranking side-by-side.

2. Seeing the ML signals and scores of all scored matches, instead of

just the final matches.

3. Editing the signals of a match and seeing the resulting ML score.

4. Manually inputting ML signals and seeing the resulting ML score.



This required adding a new observer method on the

`AutocompleteController` called when a new ML batch is scored.



This only works with sync ML scoring. Supporting async ML scoring would

add complexity, and doesn't seem worth it.



(webUI that integrates with async cpp) and low value (it's a developer

tool).

entry.title: Files app: Preparte Integration Tests for TS conversion
entry.content:
Change the base class `FileManagerBrowserTestBase` to be able to load

the extension from any of the directories of `base::BasePathKey`.



Change to load the integration test extension from the `gen/` folder

instead of `src/` in preparation to be able to load the generated JS

from the TS code.



NOTE: The tricky part here is to make the files in available to the

browser_tests binary. To be available the have to be part of the

`data` files, thus adding the ":build" target to `data_deps` in addition

to the `deps`. See `gn help runtime_deps` for more info.

use the Visual Studio mangled name on Windows. Yes, this means that

trampoline or removing the need for FFI altogether.

entry.title: [Nearby] Add GetPublicCredentials on NearbyPresenceCredentialStorage
entry.content:
GetPublicCredentials returns stored Nearby Presence shared

credentials from the specified database (local or remote). The

platform implementation of the Nearby library, hosted in the a

sandboxed utility process, will call this method to retrieve

shared credentials that were previously saved to the user's

database by a call to the existing SaveCredentials method.



A full design doc is located at

go/cros-nearby-presence-credential-storage.

entry.title: Fix FailedToGetTotalDictSize error
entry.content:
According to Net.SharedDictionaryStore.* UMA, some operations are

sometimes failing with a FailedToGetTotalDictSize error. This means that

the total_dict_size metadata is not correctly written in the database's

metadata table.



There are two possible reasons for this:

- The user enabled the CompressionDictionaryTransportBackend feature

between Chrome versions between 115.0.5739.0 (crrev.com/c/4452811)

and 115.0.5777.0 (crrev.com/c/4535857).

- Unexpected data corruption in the database file.



Currently, when this error occurs, Chromium does not recover the

database. This CL fixes this by resetting the database when the

FailedToGetTotalDictSize error is detected while running the

SharedDictionaryManagerOnDisk::CacheEvictionTask, which is executed on

every launch of Chromium.



Bug: 1413922

Change-Id: Ia10bb84b5c6bf39335a9156484f2ecb859fe86cb

entry.content:
In order to inline the action chip row, the OmniboxMatchCellView code

computes its preferred width so that the browser knows how much space to

allocate for displaying each suggestion row. Unfortunately, this

calculation seems to have omitted the tail suggest view from

consideration.



Since this manifests as a visual bug (see screenshots), this CL adds in

the tail suggest prefix width when calculating the sum total of the

preferred width for the OmniboxMatchCellView.

entry.title: Fake VAAPI VPX Integration
entry.content:
To perform software decoding on vp8 and vp9 bitstreams, the VPX software

decoder will need to be utilized.



Adds a decoder delegate owned by a context which will be the interface

for software decoders of different codecs. This update sets up a

SetRenderTarget, EnqueueWork, and a Run function to be used in the BeginPicture,

RenderPicture, and EndPicture VAAPI calls respectively.



Implements VPX decoding calls to setup the VPX decoder and successfully

decode the current frame into a vpx_image.

entry.title: Pass --disable-field-trial-config to tests that need it.
entry.content:
Affected tests already run without the testing config applied,

so this CL makes it explicit.



Context: Browser tests that use ScopedFeatureList and pass

params presently cause the field trial testing config to be

entirely disabled. (details: crbug.com/1491463#c8)

We plan to fix this, but some existing tests rely on this

(fail with the testing config). This CL annotates those

tests explicitly by making them specify the flag for that.



Once all the CLs updating such tests land (sharded via git

cl split), the following CL to make ScopedFeatureList not

disable the testing config can land:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4935093



As many tests are affected, it will be up to their owners

to do any necessary follow up if the tests should be made to

pass with the testing config (per the comments this CL adds).



Note: I did a best effort to have the new flag only apply to the

subset of tests that needed it when it was a single or a small

number of tests that were affected, by introducing subclasses

for the affected tests. In other cases, where lots of tests in

the same file fail, the flag is added to the original test class.



Note: The --disable-field-trial-config flag is passed simply

by name intentionally, to avoid additional complexity from

depending on components/variations and includes to reference

the existing constant for it. The name is unlikely to change and

this way, we need less complex code to add this to the tests.



This CL was uploaded by git cl split.



R=robliao@chromium.org

entry.title: Change popup wrapper impl to accept {0,0} sizes
entry.content:
Chrome does not disallow (0, 0) sizes while the XDG protocol does. There

are scenarios (although very unlikely), where the computed size for a

popup could be (0, 0), for example, if the menu were to somehow appear

outside of the display area.



I suspect that the original bug has to do with an incorrect display

being returned when computing which display was the closest to the

anchor point. Some menus will clip using Rect::Intersect when it is not

possible to place the menu within the provided display area. This could

potentially result in a size of {0, 0}. I was able to force this

behaviour by forcibly providing the wrong display.



Remove the CHECKs and allow these events to occur now. I still added in

logging and a dump to try to pin down how this is happening.



Fixed: 1487627

Change-Id: I3119b014c3d503800c56e329e4eb3e48170a0b0b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4933167

Reviewed-by: Mitsuru Oshima

entry.title: [Extensions UserScripts] Add error messages for script file errors
entry.content:
Add a new error message for file missing error when script is registered

dynamically (either by scripting API or user scripts API) instead of

entry.title: Add DataControlsRule parsing to ChromeDlpRulesManager
entry.content:
This CL adds parsing for the "DataControlsRule" policy, and creates

a vectors of `data_control::Rule`s in `ChromeDlpRulesManager`. This CL

is done in preparation of implementing the `ChromeDlpRulesManager`

public methods to work with that new policy, and as such no new tests

are added as existing behavior shouldn't change.



This CL also applies the following refactors to work:

- `DlpRulesManagerImpl::profile_` is moved to `ChromeDlpRulesManager`

- `OnPolicyUpdate` is split into `OnDataControlsRulesUpdate` and

`OnDataLeakPreventionRulesUpdate` to independently update the two

DLP policies as they change dynamically.

- The ctor of `DlpRulesManager` is changed to include a Profile ptr

to pass to `ChromeDlpRulesManager`. Several tests and mocks are

updated to reflect this.



Bug: b/302340176

Change-Id: I7744e5e64347f832c066be202a22d620c18d5cde

Commit-Queue: Dominique Fauteux-Chapleau

entry.title: [Extensions] Add WebRequestEventRouter class.
entry.content:
This CL adds a WebRequestEventRouter class that is a keyed service.



Additionally, this CL moves all of the functionality of the existing

ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter class into a base class, which the

new class and the existing ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter derive

from.



Based on the value of a newly-introduced feature flag, the static

Get accessor function will either return the instance of the new

class that's keyed to the supplied BrowserContext, or it will return

the singleton ExtensionWebRequestEventRouter instance. This will

allow us to enable a the new implementation but still be able to

disable it through a Finch experiment if something goes wrong.



The design doc for the entire set of changes to move to a per-

BrowserContext instance of the event router is here:



https://docs.google.com/document/d/1DGXFL7S3RB8EoTa1fWXaUh1iGrc8le1khgIo0jV-aC4/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: Reduce noisy autosharding
entry.content:
This reduces noise for two cases:

1. The current runtime is 14.5 with the desired runtime of 15.

Since 14.5 is close enough to 15, we should just leave it alone,

running a little bit faster than desired.

2. The current runtime is 10 with the desired runtime of 15.

Query suggests removing a shard but the simulated runtime is > 15.

In that case just leave it alone and let it run fast.



Bug: 1480156

Change-Id: I9aca7d62cb732b2c09c5507d796616983ec25b2b
